channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Jake Davison deadly spree took 6 minutes
item.description: Jake Davison killed five people, including a young girl, in Plymouth before turning the gun on himself.

item.title: James Markham killing: Boy, 14, charged with murder
item.description: A 14-year-old boy will appear in youth court charged with murdering James Markham.

item.title: Woman died on hold reporting boyfriend assault
item.description: Daniela Espirito Santo, from Grantham, was not failed by police, a watchdog says.

item.title: Covid vaccine fraudster who targeted 92-year-old woman jailed
item.description: David Chambers tricked his 92-year-old victim into paying £140 for a fake coronavirus vaccine.

item.title: Child killer allowed to appeal against sentence
item.description: Eltiona Skana, who killed Emily Jones in a park, is granted leave to appeal her life sentence.

item.title: Marble Arch Mound: Deputy leader resigns amid spiralling costs
item.description: Westminster Council's Melvyn Caplan steps down after total costs nearly doubled to £6m.

item.title: Shooting 'a truly shocking event' say police
item.description: Devon and Cornwall Police Chief Constable Shaun Sawyer explains how reports of the shootings came in.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Who can own a firearm or shotgun in the UK?
item.description: A shooting in Plymouth which left six people dead has put the focus on who can own a gun in the UK.

item.title: Plymouth MP: Community 'trying to make sense' of shooting
item.description: MP Luke Pollard says the community is pulling together in the face of the "deeply grim" news.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Defence Secretary rules out terrorism
item.description: Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said the shooting in Plymouth was ''a very sad and tragic event''.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Forensic investigators at the scene
item.description: Police cordoned off the area and said that the situation has been contained.

item.title: Tribute to Manchester Arena bomb survivor found dead aged 20
item.description: Eve Aston is remembered as "very jolly, sassy, sociable" by her "proud" family.

item.title: First batch of student's washing machines shipped to Iraq
item.description: Inspired by a salad spinner, Navjot Sawhney invented the hand-cranked washer four years ago.

item.title: Jomaa Jerrare: Murder arrests after Perton lay-by body find
item.description: Two suspects are detained following the discovery of Jomaa Jerrare's badly burned remains.

item.title: Channel migrants: French prosecutors investigate death
item.description: French authorities launch a manslaughter investigation after a migrant dies.

item.title: Michael Jackson fragrance fraud denied by Batley designer Hrh Arfaq
item.description: Hrh Arfaq, from West Yorkshire, sold a bottle of the perfume for £370,000, a court hears.

item.title: Car in near-miss with train on Cumbria level crossing
item.description: CCTV footage shows the car driving across the barrierless crossing in front of the Northern train.

item.title: Bolton woman inspired to create Muslim hiking group
item.description: Amira Patel says more women should be encouraged to become confident walking in the wild.

item.title: Bomb threat arrest at Northampton police station caught on film
item.description: A man is seen being tackled to the ground by officers after claiming he had a bomb in a bag.

item.title: Kane, Southgate and Sterling mural in Nuneaton nets £10,000
item.description: The three lions on the wall painting in Nuneaton helps to fund seven defibrillators.

item.title: Covid-19 testing 'mega lab' officially opens in Leamington Spa
item.description: The Leamington Spa facility has already processed about 300,000 coronavirus tests.

item.title: Ben Nevis: Amputee Ben Lovell to lead charity climb
item.description: Bradford man Ben Lovell, who lost a leg in 2017, is raising cash to send child amputees on holiday.

item.title: Privately owned e-scooters 'should be legal on roads'
item.description: Tony Mumford died a week after crashing the e-scooter his partner Cheryl Evans gave to him.

item.title: M4 near Langley and Slough to close for further smart motorway work
item.description: The weekend closure between junctions five and six will last until Monday, Highways England says.

item.title: Somerset mum creates dream prom for child with rare disease
item.description: Kiera's mother wanted her to be able to enjoy a school prom before she embarks on further treatment.

item.title: Head-bangers emotional at festival's rebirth
item.description: Last year's edition had to take place online, but head-bangers are enjoying the big comeback.

item.title: Virgil van Dijk: Liverpool defender signs deal until 2025
item.description: Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk extends his contract with the club until 2025.

item.title: Jack Grealish: Aston Villa can be stronger following £100m sale of captain, says Dean Smith
item.description: Aston Villa can build a better team following the £100m sale of Jack Grealish, manager Dean Smith says.

item.title: Joe Willock: Newcastle set to sign Arsenal midfielder on six-year deal
item.description: Newcastle boss Steve Bruce hopes to sign Joe Willock on a six-year deal by 12:00 BST so he can play against West Ham on Sunday.
